    This is the personal homepage of Elad Meidar, a web developer and an entrepreneur specializing in Ruby on Rails. I hang around Fort Lauderdale, FL and Tel-Aviv in Israel, and i am currently running Nautilus6 so Feel free to contact me regarding projects :).

GET

Bag O' Links - 26/3/2010

Links

  • Another take on Javascript inheritance – @amir_harel suggests this neat trick to imply inheritance in javascript.
  • Seven languages in Seven weeks – seems like a really neat book from PragProg.
  • Speeding up TextMate in large projects – great tips.
  • Automating Bundler in deployments – from pivotal.
  • WebSockets tutorial – yeah, it’s with python but there’s a good Ruby example other there using “Cramp”.
  • Navigation and menus roundup – i admit, navigation, menus and footers are my web-fetish.
  • Open source license types explained – in simple plain english.
  • Awesome browser support tables – HTML5 and CSS3.
  • Digg improves performance by 4000%% – by offloading calculations from DB engine to code. in contrary actually to what i thought is the right thing to do. oh well, me learz. :)
  • RabbitMQ overview – a very good writeup.
  • Hunting bugs in History – some git-bisect magic.
  • This is how i write Rails applications – James shades some light on this technique in a really interesting read.
  • Implementing LockFile with Ruby – really useful if for some reason you need to implement a Mutex on your own.
  • Javascript coding conventions – a collection of code convention suggestions for Javascript.
  • Databases are for pussies – a vulgar name for a great article, also introduces tyrone, a rapid prototyping Sinatra based solution.
  • Yahoo!’s Hadoop tutorial – wuhoo.

Treasures

  • BlueLight – an extension to Clearance that includes roles and some administration roots.
  • API King – an API providers aggregator.
  • CloudCache – offers simple and affordable on-demand caching.
  • Impl – Javascript ORM (requires HTML5).
  • Notifo – a Ruby wrapper for Notifo, allows sending push messages to mobile users.
  • Artifice – A few weeks ago i made a gem that used sinatra to mock a webservice, wycats wins with this one.
  • MooTouch – the MooTools clone of jQTouch.
